intro: Pycnostachys bequaertii, commonly known as the Bequaert's pycnostachys, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
